blocks.text: The FT-891 is a rugged HF/50 MHz transceiver for mobile and portable operation. It provides 100 W output on 160-6 meters with SSB, CW, AM, FM, and digital modes. The detachable front panel allows flexible installation.
To turn the transceiver ON or OFF, press and hold the [PWR/LOCK] key. While on, briefly press [PWR/LOCK] to engage/disengage the MAIN DIAL knob lock.
To select the operating band, press [BAND] to display the band selection screen, then rotate the MAIN DIAL to select your band. The selection is confirmed automatically after 0.5 seconds.
To select the operating mode, press and hold [BAND(MODE)] for one second to display the mode selection screen, then rotate the MAIN DIAL to choose SSB, CW, RTTY, DATA, AM, or FM.
The MULTI function knob provides quick access to many features. Press it to adjust frequency in 500 kHz steps, or use it to navigate menus and adjust settings when a function is active.
The [A], [B], and [C] programmable keys provide quick access to frequently used functions. Default assignments are: [A]=IF SHIFT, [B]=SCOPE, [C]=Noise Blanker.

To access the Menu mode, press and hold the [F] key for one second. Rotate the MULTI knob to select a menu item, press the knob to enter edit mode, rotate to adjust, then press again to save. Press [F] to exit.

blocks.name: 01-01 AGC FAST DELAY
blocks.description: Sets the AGC recovery time for FAST setting. Range: 20-4000 msec. Default: 300 msec.

blocks.name: 02-01 LCD CONTRAST
blocks.description: Adjusts the LCD display contrast. Range: 1-15. Default: 8.

blocks.name: 02-02 DIMMER BACKLIT
blocks.description: Adjusts the backlight brightness. Range: 1-15. Default: 8.

blocks.name: 05-05 RF/SQL VR
blocks.description: Selects the function of the RF/SQL knob: RF (RF gain control) or SQL (squelch control). Default: RF.

blocks.name: 05-18 CLAR SELECT
blocks.description: Sets clarifier operation mode: RX (receive offset only), TX (transmit offset only), or TRX (both). Default: RX.

blocks.name: 14-01 QUICK DIAL
blocks.description: Sets the frequency step when using the MULTI knob: 50, 100, or 500 kHz. Default: 500 kHz.

blocks.name: 16-07 SSB MIC GAIN
blocks.description: Adjusts SSB microphone gain. Range: 0-100. Default: 50.

blocks.text: Connect a key or keyer paddle to the rear panel KEY jack. Select CW mode by holding [BAND(MODE)] and rotating the MAIN DIAL. Press [F] to access CW SETTING mode.

blocks.name: BK-IN
blocks.description: Enables/disables semi break-in operation. When enabled, the transmitter engages automatically when keying, and returns to receive after the configured delay.

blocks.name: KEYER
blocks.description: Enables/disables the built-in electronic keyer. Enable when using a paddle, disable when using a straight key or external keyer.

blocks.name: SPEED
blocks.description: Adjusts the keyer speed from 4 to 60 WPM. Press the MULTI knob in CW SETTING mode, then rotate to adjust.

blocks.name: PITCH
blocks.description: Sets the CW sidetone pitch from 300 to 1050 Hz. This also affects the receive tone frequency.

blocks.name: APF (Audio Peak Filter)
blocks.description: Activates a narrow audio filter centered on the CW pitch to improve weak signal copy. Adjustable within ±250 Hz.

blocks.name: ZIN
blocks.description: Zero-in function automatically adjusts the receive frequency to match an incoming CW signal. Press and hold to output a CW tone for tuning.

blocks.name: 07-09 CW BK-IN DELAY
blocks.description: Sets the delay before returning to receive after the last CW element. Range: 30-3000 msec. Default: 200 msec.

blocks.text: The FT-891 features comprehensive DSP filtering including IF SHIFT, IF WIDTH, CONTOUR, IF NOTCH, Noise Reduction, and Auto-Notch functions.

blocks.name: IF SHIFT (SFT)
blocks.description: Moves the DSP filter passband up to ±1.2 kHz without changing the receive pitch. Press the assigned [A] key, then rotate the MULTI knob to reduce interference. Press and hold MULTI to reset to center.

blocks.name: NB (Noise Blanker)
blocks.description: Reduces pulse-type noise from ignition systems. Available in SSB/CW/RTTY/DATA/AM modes. Adjust the blanking level with the MULTI knob; excessive levels may distort audio.

blocks.name: DNR (Digital Noise Reduction)
blocks.description: Activates DSP noise reduction with 15 selectable algorithms. Rotate the MULTI knob to choose the algorithm that best reduces background noise.

blocks.name: DNF (Digital Notch Filter)
blocks.description: Enables/disables the DSP Auto Notch Filter to automatically remove interfering carriers.

blocks.name: CNT (Contour)
blocks.description: Shapes the audio frequency response for more natural sound. Activate and rotate the MULTI knob to achieve optimal audio quality.

blocks.name: AGC
blocks.description: Automatic Gain Control with selectable recovery times: FAST (300ms), MID (700ms), SLOW (3000ms), or AUTO. Press to toggle; press MULTI to turn AGC OFF.

blocks.text: The FT-891 requires a 13.8 V DC power source with at least 23 A capacity. Use only the supplied DC power cable and connect directly to a 12 V car battery (negative ground) or regulated power supply.
Do not use the cigarette lighter connector as a power source. High current during transmission requires direct battery connection.
The Limited Warranty does not cover damage caused by AC voltage, reverse polarity DC, or DC voltage outside the specified 13.8 V ±15% range.
For mobile installations, route the DC cable at least 20 cm away from engine control units, transmission electronics, ECS/EPS/ABS systems, and air conditioner controls.
The FT-891 does not include an internal antenna tuner but supports optional external tuners: the FC-50 and FC-40 automatic antenna tuners, and the ATAS-120A active tuning antenna.
Connect the optional FC-40 or FC-50 tuner to the rear panel TUN/LIN jack using the supplied control cable. Enable the tuner via Menu mode 16-15 [TUNER SELECT] set to EXTERNAL.
For the ATAS-120A antenna, enable ATAS SETTING in Menu mode 05-12, then access the ATAS controls by pressing [F] repeatedly. Use the up/down controls to raise or lower the antenna element.
The FT-891 is designed for 50 ohm resistive impedance. Maintain SWR of 1.5:1 or less for maximum performance and transmitter protection.

rows.name: Modes
rows.value: SSB, CW, AM, FM, RTTY, DATA

blocks.name: No power on
blocks.description: Check DC power cable connections and 25 A fuse. Verify power source provides 13.8 V DC with adequate current capacity (23 A minimum).

blocks.name: Dial locked
blocks.description: Press [PWR/LOCK] briefly to toggle the dial lock. The LOCK icon appears on the display when engaged.

blocks.name: No transmit audio
blocks.description: Check microphone connection and gain settings in Menu 16-07 (SSB), 16-08 (AM), or 16-09 (FM). Verify the correct PTT source is selected.

blocks.name: High SWR reading
blocks.description: Check antenna connections and feedline. Verify antenna is properly tuned for the operating frequency. Use an external antenna tuner if necessary.

blocks.name: Ignition noise
blocks.description: Enable the Noise Blanker ([C] key or FUNCTION-2 menu). Adjust the blanking level for best noise reduction without audio distortion.

blocks.name: Factory reset
blocks.description: To reset all settings: Press and hold [F], select Menu 17-01 [RESET], choose ALL, then press and hold MULTI to confirm. The transceiver will restart with factory defaults.

blocks.name: CW not keying
blocks.description: Verify break-in (BK-IN) is enabled in CW SETTING mode. Check that the keyer is enabled if using a paddle, or disabled if using a straight key.
